channel.title: Comments on: The Many Paths to Open Access

item.title: By: Anneliese Taylor
item.dc:creator: Anneliese Taylor
item.description: Thanks Susan. Since the overwhelming response was for a Slack channel, I'll go ahead and add one. :-)
item.content:encoded: Thanks Susan. Since the overwhelming response was for a Slack channel, I’ll go ahead and add one. ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Susan Boone
item.dc:creator: Susan Boone
item.description: I like the idea of a scholarly communications Slack channel. Slack is well suited for dialog. (And thanks!)
item.content:encoded: I like the idea of a scholarly communications Slack channel. Slack is well suited for dialog. (And thanks!)

item.title: By: Anneliese Taylor
item.dc:creator: Anneliese Taylor
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/staff.library.ucsf.edu/2016/08/03/the-many-paths-to-open-access/#comment-590">Alan Daniel</a>.
Thanks, Alan. I haven't seen anything specific about how much revenue ads contribute, but I'll keep an eye out for that info.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Alan Daniel.

Thanks, Alan. I haven’t seen anything specific about how much revenue ads contribute, but I’ll keep an eye out for that info.

item.title: By: Alan Daniel
item.dc:creator: Alan Daniel
item.description: Wiki pages, blog posts, and presentations I think. Thank you for a very informative presentation. Is there much discussion on how advertisements reduce costs? I looked on PLoS and they cite $40.00/cpm which I assume means someone must click through on the banner.
item.content:encoded:
Wiki pages, blog posts, and presentations I think. Thank you for a very informative presentation.
Is there much discussion on how advertisements reduce costs? I looked on PLoS and they cite $40.00/cpm which I assume means someone must click through on the banner.
